name: drying of feed grain | drying of feed grain | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11075/documentation

The functional unit is kg water evaporated. This module should be used when evaluating drying of cereals and maize grains used as feedstuff.;Dataset based on GLO parent dataset. The only differences with the parent dataset are (1) the production volume, which now represents the production volume in Quebec; (2) Data Quality Pedigree indicators which was modified to account for the fact that GLO data is used to represent Quebec activities; (3) the geographical location and (4) energy demand which has been adapted acordingly to Quebec specificity.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of grains, at the silo gate. Drying process starting from grains, wet (low moisture content). 

This activity ends with dried grains at silo gate. 
The dataset includes the energy demand (supplied by consumption of electricity) for evaporating 1 kg of water, when drying grain at low moisture content at ambiant air. Also included in the inventory is the infrastructure (building and machinery) and land use. 
The dataset does not include waste and air emissions (like dust).Production of the wet educt and utilisation of the dried product are not included.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0163:Post-harvest crop activities

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time of publication in literature and annual reports for parent data. Most publications between 2001 and 2002.;;Electricity consumption is based on a 2010 report from the CRAAQ and might be representative of more recent time period than the GLO parent dataset.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventories are based on Quebec technical data (for energy consumption) and indications made by drying plants in Switzerland and values given in international references (Western Europe) (for parent data).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Drying at farm, in silo, at ambiant air temperature of grains for animal feed (barley, oat wheat, canola and soybeans). Silo average capacity is 240 tonnes.;This technology is used when grains can be harvest at low moisture content (e.g. about 18%), hence avoiding the need of hot air drying. Ambiant air drying in silo lasts 15 days. Afterwards, grains are stored in a ventilated silo for 4 days. Dust and particulate emission to air are not considered.  ;References : ;BEAUREGARD, G. (2013). Production budget of agricultural productions in Quebec. Technical report for CIRAIG.;CRAAQ (2010). Séchage des grains - Données techniques. AGDEX 736, juin 2010, 6p. [Centre de Référence en Agriculture et Agroalimentaire du Québec]
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Dataset based on GLO parent dataset.Infrastructure and land occupation data are kept from parent dataset and may not be representative of the geography and the technology. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
